properties.name: Ogopogo
properties.description: In Canadian folklore, Ogopogo or Naitaka (Salish: n'ha-a-itk, spirit of the lake) is a lake monster reported to live in Okanagan Lake, in the Okanagan valley of British Columbia, Canada. The most common description of Ogopogo is a 40 to 50-foot-long (12 to 15 m) sea serpent. Ogopogo has been allegedly seen by First Nations people since the 19th century.
